Before you proceed.data: As a prerequesite, the device needs to be treblized. Instructions from #{1} Flash and boot the custom twrp recovery #{2}, then in recovery, go to Advanced -> Terminal and run the command `treblize` You will then need to flash the latest firmware in recovery (9.0.6). It is important to note that firmware is device specific, so be sure to pick the correct one from `https://github.com/nvertigo/firmware-3t/tree/master/archive` Now in recovery, flash the LineageOS 16 treble build from #{3}. After installed, boot into LineageOS and confirm everything is working. Lastly, boot back into recovery, go to `Wipe` -> `Advanced Wipe` -> Select everything except `Vendor` and `USB-OTG`, then `Swipe to Wipe`. Then reboot back into recovery. Now your device is treblized and you can proceed to install Droidian.

Droidian installation.data: Install the required base Android version (9)

data: Install the file called lineage-16.0-20200522-UNOFFICIAL-oneplus3 as a Zip file using twrp-op3treble-3.3.1-1.img
Alternatively, you can enter ADB sideload mode and run adb sideload lineage-16.0-20200522-UNOFFICIAL-oneplus3
Install the file called droidian-rootfs-arm64_YYYYMMDD.zip as a Zip file
Alternatively, you can enter ADB sideload mode and run adb sideload droidian-OFFICIAL-phosh-phone-rootfs-apiXX-arm64_YYYYMMDD.zip
devtools is already included in nightly builds.

Finalizing the installation.data: Install adaptation package as a flashable zip (twrp-op3treble-3.3.1-1.img)

Finalizing the installation.data: Congratulations, if everything went well you should be booted into Droidian.

Unlocking SIM.data: After entering a pin code to unlock your SIM card, you need to restart the Settings application to get access to the Mobile Network settings because the menu doesn’t update automatically.

Empty APN dialog.data: If you get an empty Access Points window even after you have entered the info, ofono is not working properly. Run the command ‘sudo systemctl restart ofono.service’ to solve the issue.

Dual SIM.data: Dual SIM functionality is currently not implemented in Phosh so only one SIM works at the moment.

Offline Charging.data: When powered off, plugging in a charger will power on the device. If you experience a flashing screen, reboot to solve the issue. If the phone is powered on manually or rebooted, there won’t be any screen flashing.

Camera.data: Camera doesn’t yet work in Droidian or Waydroid.

GPU.data: Currently GPU only works partially in Droidian, but in Waydroid it works perfectly.

SSH access.data: Flashing the devtools zip enables SSH over USB. To use it, connect your phone to your computer and type ssh droidian@10.15.19.82, the password is 1234 (on Windows, you may need #{1})
